definition: to have boundless prospects
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
way/route/road
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to measure

sentences.english: At any rate the theoretical prospect seems no longer precluded.
sentences.chinese: 至少從理論上來說，這項事業似乎前途無量。

sentences.english: Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measures.
sentences.chinese: 我們最恐懼的是我們前途無量。

sentences.english: That young ball player will bear watching.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年球員前途無量。

sentences.english: We should keep an eye on this kid. Definitely a bright future.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該留意一下科沃爾這個年輕人，前途無量啊。

sentences.english: May I wish you every success for the future?
sentences.chinese: 祝你前途無量馬到成功。

definition: chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
reckless/extremely daring
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
young and vigorous (idiom)
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
protective coloration/camouflage
stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
a meat pie falls from the sky (idiom)/to have something fall into your lap
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
